page.title: 13Hanley Castle Parish Council
page.content: At the last Annual General Meeting of the Parish Council on May 23rd 1985, several local issues were dealt with. It was asked that builders carrying out alterations to property in the area should leave no rubbish around. Many people are concerned with the attractiveness of both Hanley Swan and Hanley Castle,as they enter a biennial 'best kept village competition'. The Senior Residents receive a yearly travel token of Â£7 each.As so few buses run in the area,the Chairman wondered if a more efficient way of using the money could be found. Complaints about punctures to bicycle tyres after farmers had been hedge cutting with modern equipment. The Chairman himself a farmer promised to have a word with local farmers to ask for their co_operation in tidying the roads after hedge cutting.
